item.title: Report E-2025040299
item.description:
Report E-2025040299

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The leaking container was picked up by Veolia from a customer on 4/2/25 and transporter to the Veolia 10 Day In-Transit facility located at 3100 Hedley Street, Philadelphia, PA 19137. The container was offloaded with other containers and placed on another transport vehicle the afternoon of 4/2/25. The following day, the container was inspected and was not observed to be leaking. On 4/4/25 during a routine inspection of the site, the container was determined to be leaking as a small wet area was observed around the circumference of the bottom of the container. The container was placed in a salvage drum, and the area decontaminated. The leak was caused most likely by potential damage to the container or a leaking seam in the plastic.

item.title: Report X-2025040174
item.description:
Report X-2025040174

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Freight was loaded on beams in the trailer and fell off the beams in transit due to lack of blocking and bracing. The operations assistant advised that the freight was billed as two pallets of books, but advised that the freight appears to be Fuji Film plate developer replenisher in jugs in boxes showing corrosive 8. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.~~Called CURA and spoke with Lizzie who advised a crew would be sent out and will attempt to clarify details. ~~Cura advised the product to be UN1814, Potassium hydroxide, solution, 8, PG II.

NO LIQUID ON THE BELT NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.description:
Report E-2025040030

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A mechanic was replacing a placard holder on the side of a trailer and when drilling a hole in the side of the trailer to mount the placard holder they drilled through a drum that was staged inside of the trailer consequently puncturing it and contributing to the unintentional release. The drum was laid on it's side and repaired with drum putty and the spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed in a recovery container as was the punctured drum.
